text: The 2009 Soweto Open was a professional tennis tournament played on Hard courts. It was part of the 2009 ATP Challenger Tour. It took place in Johannesburg, South Africa between 13 and 18 April 2009. ==Singles entrants== ===Seeds=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Nationality ! Player ! Ranking* ! Seeding |- | | Fabrice Santoro | 52 | 1 |- | | Gilles Müller | 67 | 2 |- | | ~~Michael Berrer~~ | ~~109~~ | ~~3~~ |- | | Thiago Alves | 121 | 4 |- | | Michail Elgin | 135 | 5 |- | | Nicolas Mahut | 139 | 6 |- | | Chris Guccione | 149 | 7 |- | | Karol Beck | 159 | 8 |} *Rankings are as of 6 April 2009. ===Other entrants=== The following players received wildcards into the singles main draw: * Andrew Anderson * Raven Klaasen * Fritz Wolmarans The following players entry from the qualifying draw: * Chris Eaton * Jun Woong- Sun * Denys Molchanov * Noam Okun The following players entry from Lucky Loser draw: * Benjamin Janse van Rensburg ==Champions== ===Men's singles=== Fabrice Santoro def. Rik de Voest, 7–5, 6–4 ===Men's doubles=== Chris Guccione / George Bastl def. Michail Elgin / Alexandre Kudryavtsev, 6–2, 4–6, [11–9] ==References== *2009 Draws *Official website *South Africa Tennis Association official website *ITF search Soweto Open Category:Tennis tournaments in South Africa Category:Soweto Open
title: 2009 Soweto Open
